reviews.review_msg: Nice man,but provides no clarity.Must expect TA to do most of this, but doesn't. Take other prof. for osteology if you want a shot at doing well.Says something won't be on a test the next thing it is on the test!

Kim is by far the most amazing prof I've had. She is extremely helpful and trys her best to help you succeed in a challenging class.  If you show up to open lab, ask question, and read the book you'll do well!
he was a good professor but incredible hard to understand due to his accent. I found at times that i could not understand entire sections of his lectures.
Very good/helpful Prof.His English is a little hard to understand sometimes. very knowledgeable of the subject he is teaching. his lab assistant antonia was also very helpful. thumbs up!!

Very helpful professor during lectures and labs. Tries to make his lectures fun and jokes around. Personally find his class very engaging, and he seems to be a fair marker. Definitely encourage taking his classes as long as you take the time to attend labs and seeking help from TA.

Dongya is a really nice guy, and he will try and help you as best he can, However he is really difficult to understand and I found i had a hard time getting information out of his lectures. He does compensate fairly well with his lecture notes and they are all available online

I LOVE DONGYA! he's honestly the nicest proff i've ever had. He really cares about his students and wants them to succeed, he will always help you when you need it.  He's so easygoing, and has such a great happy disposition. He is enthusiastic about the subject, and he works hard to make sure you understand the subject. Love the guy!
Osteo with Dongya is tough but fair. This was the first class I ever really had to work for, but if you work hard you will be rewarded.

So nice and funny. His lectures are fun and he is very enthusiastic. He is sometimes hard to understand but he knows it and does his best to be clear. Powerpoint lectures are available online which helps a lot.
Enjoys what he does and this really comes across to his students. Wants everyone to do well. Very approachable and has a good sense of humour.Very knowledgeable.
Extremely helpful, funny, and approachable.

Great prof! It's been a very interesting class! The labs aren't super hard unless you're not going to them and open labs, which I recommend not missing! He also has an adjustable grading scheme so you can get the best final grade that works to your benefit. Read the text, go to lectures and labs, and you'll do well. I'm so glad I took this class :)

Dr. Cardoso & the TA this semester truly care about their students' well-being and success! Both were friendly and approachable - I would not hesitate to take another class with Dr. Cardoso. He offers an extremely flexible grading scheme and extra credit, as well as an open lab. Highly advise going to open lab - makes an enormous difference!

Such a good prof, genuinely cares about students + wants us to learn. Grading criteria is very clear and generous too. Lab quizzes are a bit tricky but go to open labs as much as you can + practice lots and you should be fine. The lab instructor/TA Mariana was amazing as well! very knowledgeable + helpful in labs. Def recommend taking this course!!

Best class I've ever taken, prof and TA were both amazing! He really cares about his students & is very fair. He offers a VERY flexible grading system & an extra credit!! Super approachable, knowledgeable and honest. Difficult class but go to labs and you'll be fine!

Hugo is a fantastic person and prof, the course is very challenging but go to every lab and open lab and you'll do well. If you are struggling with something TALK TO HIM, he's actually very approachable and kind. You have the option to submit your lab note folder for a grade boost. He really wants students to do well.

Hugo is an amazing prof, he is super knowledgeable and clearly passionate about osteology. He gets to know all of his students (makes sense bc it's so lab heavy) and has students participate in lecture. It's a pretty difficult course, you need to go to lab every week. Go to open labs as well, they will save you
Best prof. I have ever had. Really hard class but super fun.
Buy the lab manual. ATTEND open lab hours. Get your hands on those bones. Everything will make sense when you touch the bones with your hand and learn them with your heart.
amazing and articulate prof, cares about his students and the course content. make sure you attend all labs, as well as the extra lab time.

Be prepared to remember A LOT of features. Labs are super important, and going to open labs will help. Hugo is a good prof if you take the initiative to ask him questions or for help. He's knowledgeable and knows the material really well. I think he knows the class is hard, so he offers chances for easy marksextra credit.  tl;dr hard class, study
Great prof, lots of information, couple of videos, good to attend as gives sample Final questions each lecture, good to go. LOTS to know for lab quizzes, lots of fragmented parts.

His lectures are interesting but will soon lost interest in it especially when it's 3 hours long and at 830am. The lab quizzes are easy when you study. fair game. overall gained a lot from this course, you will learn a lot and can use it back in real life!

Get ready to study study study! Incredibly difficult class but its clear Grace wants you to succeed. Very kind and approachable. Labs were not as helpful for learning/memorizing course material as I hoped they would be but I don't think thats her fault.
Hard Course, Good prof. She's nice and fair. But can be difficult to understand sometimes. Overall I am enjoying her class.

This was a difficult class but Grace made it much easier by her kind and helpful demeanor. Lectures are dense but clear, labs involve lots of memorizing and hands-on work with the bones. If you go to open labs and study you can do well and there is also an essay and possible extra-credit. Can't recommend Grace enough, such a good class and prof!
